thread.title: Qualcomm Buys Medical Data Management Company
thread.title_full: Qualcomm Buys Medical Data Management Company

author: morningstar.com
title: Qualcomm Buys Medical Data Management Company
text:
By Lisa Beilfuss
Qualcomm Inc. (QCOM) said Monday that it has acquired privately-held medical data management company Capsule Technologie, a move to expand its Qualcomm Life subsidiary.
Terms of the transaction weren't disclosed.
The acquisition of Capsule, based in Andover, Mass., extends Qualcomm Life's connected health offerings into the hospital, Qualcomm said. Capsule delivers clinical data to various in-hospital decision support systems, alarm and notification systems, and asset management tools, which help reduce latency and transcription errors, according to Qualcomm.
Qualcomm, the world's largest maker of chips used in mobile phones, has been under pressure from activist investor Jana Partners LLC. Jana in April took a roughly $2 billion stake in the company and has been pushing Qualcomm to explore a breakup, cut costs, repurchase shares faster and bring new blood to its board.
Write to Lisa Beilfuss at lisa.beilfuss@wsj.com
